data.title: Great Films starring Robin Williams - Chicago Public Library
data.meta_description: Great Films starring Robin Williams by ChiPubLib_Adults - a staff-created list : A tribute to Robin Williams from Greg at Little Village Branch.
data.text:
Based on the French classic, Robin Williams and Nathan Lane deliver incredible performances in this ahead-of-its-time comedy. Though Lane and Williams dom...Show more Based on the French classic, Robin Williams and Nathan Lane deliver incredible performances in this ahead-of-its-time comedy. Though Lane and Williams dominate the screen with powerful personalities, the best moments of the film are quieter, character focused scenes that allow these amazing talents to flesh out characters that might otherwise be caricature. A comedy with a message of acceptance. Show less

A period drama with Williams in a supporting role as an unconventional educator, Dead Poets Society showed off Williams’s dramatic range without abandoning the comedic style that served him so well. Nostalgic, funny, and endlessly quotable. A period drama with Williams in a supporting role as an unconventional educator, Dead Poets Society showed off Williams’s dramatic range without abandoning the comedic style that served him so well. Nostalgic, funny, and endlessly quotable. Show less

Robin Williams and Jeff Bridges in a modern, morose fairy tale. Williams brings his characteristic energy to the screen, his flights of fancy providing co...Show more Robin Williams and Jeff Bridges in a modern, morose fairy tale. Williams brings his characteristic energy to the screen, his flights of fancy providing counterpoint to the grim reality Jeff Bridges is trying to emerge from. A film about loss, grief, and transformation. Show less

Loosely based on the experiences of Air-Force DJ Adrian Cronauer, Williams stars as an irrepressible radioman who uses humor and a great playlist to get s...Show more Loosely based on the experiences of Air-Force DJ Adrian Cronauer, Williams stars as an irrepressible radioman who uses humor and a great playlist to get soldiers through the day. Thoroughly focused on Williams’ bombastic personality, Good Morning, Vietnam punctuates manic energy with sobering moments of drama. A uniquely energetic war film. Show less

Williams’s Oscar-winning performance of a soft-spoken but worldly psychologist seems to be a departure from his earlier, hyperkinetic work. A solidly grounded drama, Williams brings an understated charm to a film filled with big performances. Williams’s Oscar-winning performance of a soft-spoken but worldly psychologist seems to be a departure from his earlier, hyperkinetic work. A solidly grounded drama, Williams brings an understated charm to a film filled with big performances. Show less
